dlentry.dd: Acronym for Advanced Message Queuing Protocol.
A software tool for automating software build processes. See Ant for more info.
A build automation tool typically used for Java projects. See Maven for more info.

Any application software intended for instantiation in Application Lifecycle Service. At minimum it consists of the application, expressed in a dynamic language, plus a configuration file named manifest.yml.
An implementation of multicast DNS and related protocols.

A set of interconnected physical processors or virtual machines, managed at least conceptually as a single entity but otherwise operating autonomously. Historically the term carried a variety of proprietary meanings, but came into general use with the rapid development of supercomputing based upon Beowulf Clusters. An Application Lifecycle Service cluster is one in which role s are assigned or replicated to multiple cluster node s.

Within Application Lifecycle Service, the term component is used when naming a discrete part of the Application Lifecycle Service server. For example, a
role is made up of one or more components.

A lightweight form of virtualization which provides resource isolation and secure separation for multiple instances of the same base system. According to circumstances it may be used in addition to or instead of hypervisor virtualization.
Acronym for Comprehensive Perl Archive Network.
A consistent distributed data store. Used for cluster management in Application Lifecycle Service. (see Doozer project on GitHub)

Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. The DHCP service is used to allocate IP addresses to clients on demand and to supply other basic network information they need, such as the addresses of a default router and DNS server.
Domain Name System. Resolves domain names to IP addresses.
A lightweight server for locally integrating DNS with DHCP/BOOTP.

A means of rapidly updating the Domain Name System, possibly making use of RFC 2136
Dynamic Updates.

In Application Lifecycle Service, filesystem refers to persistent storage accessed by an application :term`service` specified in manifest.yml through a server which has been assigned the filesystem
role .
A notation for structured text data, acronym for JavaScript Object Notation.
Application Lifecycle Service's implementation of an RFC 3259 message queue used for interprocess communication. See also: NATS .

Free & open source, high-performance, distributed memory object caching system, generic in nature, but intended for use in speeding up dynamic web applications by alleviating database load. (see Memcached project page)

A preconfigured Application Lifecycle Service virtual machine image consisting of a single generic node enabled for all the
role s necessary for basic operation, but with no preinstalled app s or service s.
A popular noSQL database management system.

A distributed means of configuring DNS by multicast discovery. It is supported on Application Lifecycle Service :term`micro cloud` servers using
Avahi .
A relational database management system.
Acronym for Network Address Translation.

In Application Lifecycle Service, a publish-subscribe message system implemented as a process called nats-server which listens on a network interface, normally on port 4222/tcp. Messages published across the network to a particular MBUS queue managed by the nats-server are communicated to clients which are subscribed to that queue.
Nginx is a high-performance, event-driven web server.

An Application Lifecycle Service node is a single processing host in a
cluster , typically a virtual machine running under a hypervisor.
Acronym for Open Virtualization Format, a specification for virtual machine images developed by the DMTF industry consortium.
Acronym for Platform as a Service.
A tool for installing and managing Python packages, such as those found in the Python Package Index. It's a replacement for easy_install. See pip-installer for more information.

PyPM is the binary package manager for ActivePython. It is usually the fastest and most reliable way of installing PyPI packages for your Application Lifecycle Service applications. The PyPM repository hosts almost all of the Python packages registered in PyPI and includes their latest versions. See PyPM for more information.
A lightweight caching web proxy intended for small applications.
A relational database management system.
A private PaaS is one which is hosted on your private cloud, behind your firewall.
A message broker subsystem which implements AMQP .
An implementation of memory resident key-value store.
A system configuration tool typically used by hook scripts at boot time. See the resolvconf man page for details.

Each node in an Application Lifecycle Service cluster
may be assigned certain selectable capabilities within the Application Lifecycle Service architecture. These capabilities are called roles, and are usually denoted in lowercase. Examples of essential roles are router, primary, controller, and dea. In addition, there are role groups (for convenience) such as data-services that represent all data-services. (postgresql mysql rabbit mongodb redis filesystem memcached)
In Application Lifecycle Service, a service is a type of role that may be provisioned on a server and accessed by an application as specified in manifest.yml.
A process control system used by Application Lifecycle Service internally. (see Supervisor project page)
The hypervisor window which provides serial console access to one of its virtual machines.
A notation for structured text data, acronym for YAML Ain't Markup Language, used inmanifest.yml configuration files.
